title: Better focus
description: Meditation is a practice of focusing our attention and being aware of when it drifts. This improves our focus outside our meditation session.

title: More creativity
description: Study showed that people who practiced mindful meditation performed better on a task that asked them to come up with new ideas.

title: Increased immunity
description: Relaxation and mindful meditation boosted immunity, resistance to tumours and viruses and reduced the risk of breast cancer recurrence.

title: Better memory
description: People who practiced mindful meditation were able to focus, block distractions, improve their rapid memory recall & increase their productivity.

title: Less stress
description: Mindful meditation has been shown to help people perform better under pressure, cope with situation, while feeling less stressed.

title: Less anxiety
description: Meditation helps us look at scary or upsetting thoughts, emotions and sensations rationally, with calmness, detachment and greater control.

title: More gray matter
description: More gray matter leads to emotional stability and heightened focus during daily life. Meditation also helps reduce the decline of cognitive functioning.

title: Emotional balance
description: Meditation help deal with unhealthy emotional states, traumas, neurosis and neurotic behavior that results from a tortured and traumatized ego.

title: Increased fertility
description: Women are more likely to conceive when they are relaxed. Relaxation lowers stress, that impacts sperm count and motility, and boosts male fertility.

title: Relieves irritable bowel syndrome
description: When patients suffering from irritable bowel syndrome began practising meditation 2x a day, symptoms of bloating, diarrhea and constipation improved.

title: Lowers blood pressure
description: A study at Harvard Medical School found that meditation lowered blood pressure by making the body less responsive to stress hormones.

title: Anti-inflammatory
description: Stress leads to inflammation, a state linked to heart disease, arthritis, asthma and psoriasis. Relaxation can help by switching off the stress response.

title: Calmness
description: In meditative mind, the thought is witnessed, while in an ordinary mind, the thought is the boss. In meditative mind, upsetting thought is just another thought.
